tr: Zaman zaman, çok sevilen eski bir binayı yıkıp yerine yeni bir apartman bloğu inşa etme önerisi, büyük tepkilere neden olur.

en: Sometimes the boys would play a joke on the teacher.
I hear from him once in a while.
From time to time she stopped and looked round.
tr: Zaman zaman durur ve etrafına bakınırdı.

en: From time to time, he goes to the library to get new information about books.
tr: Zaman zaman, kitaplar hakkında yeni bilgiler edinmek için kütüphaneye gider.

en: Sometimes we lie to keep from hurting someone else's feelings.
tr: Bazen başkalarını incitmemek için yalan söyleriz.

en: Degas was born more than 150 years ago.
tr: Degas 150 yıldan uzun zaman önce doğdu.

en: A new year began meanwhile.

en: It should be noted that Dole did not intend to change the configuration of the communication protocol.

en: Not a soul was to be seen in the street.
Mr Thomas is a very able teacher.
tr: Thomas Bey çok başarılı bir öğretmen.

en: Mr Thomas will be able to solve the problem.

tr: Thomas Bey'in, White Bey'in başkan seçilmesine bir itirazı yoktu.

en: Thomas hurried away so as to be in time for the train.
tr: Thomas trene yetişmek için acele etti.

en: Thomas could not carry out his task on account of an accident.
tr: Thomas bir kaza nedeniyle görevini yapamadı.

en: Let me congratulate you on your victory in the tournament.

en: Totem poles consist of a group of figures that represent animals, birds, fish, mythological beings and supernatural beasts.
tr: Totem direkleri hayvanları, kuşları, balıkları, mitolojik varlıkları ve doğaüstü yaratıkları temsil eden bir grup figürden oluşur.

en: These poles, called totem poles, are thought to have been worshipped or constructed for frightening enemies.
tr: Totem direği denilen bu direklerin, kendilerine tapıldığı ya da düşmanları korkutmak için yapıldığı düşünülüyor.

en: I've burnt the toast.
The toast has burned black.
It's as hot as toast.
I'd like two slices of toast and a cup of tea.
tr: İki dilim kızarmış ekmek ve bir bardak çay alayım lütfen.

en: I had to fix the toaster.
tr: Tost makinesini tamir etmek zorunda kaldım.

en: Give me five tokens, please.
Dorgan didn't know how to spell dachshund.
tr: Dorgan, dachshund kelimesini nasıl yazacağını bilmiyordu.

en: What do you make of it?
Can you come?
A fierce dog attacked the girl.
There's no way I can make it up to you.

en: No matter what the excuse, he is to be blamed.

en: How shall I put it?
How is it going?
Every means has failed.

tr: Çok iyimser bir tahminle bile en fazla 2.000 kişi vardı.

en: This is hardly the time to start a new enterprise.

en: Now, what do you think?
On what account?

To all appearance, they don't study hard.
To all appearances, their actions haven't borne fruit.
To all appearance his statement was true.
Please let me know how you are going to solve.
tr: Nasıl çözeceğini bana haber ver lütfen.

en: What's the difference?
How do you go to school?
Tell me how you solved the problem.
I'm afraid it will rain tomorrow.
Evidently, it's going to rain tomorrow.
I seem to have caught a cold.
He seems to know all about her past.

en: He seems to have been ill for a long time.
I seem to have left my umbrella behind in the train.
It looks like it's going to be sunny.

It looks as if you're right.

How did the secret get out?
How can you break the news to her?
How did he come here?
How will they get through the cold winter in that tent?

en: How do you make a box?
How does he gain his living?

How did you get them?

en: How can you justify your rude behavior?

en: How did you come to school?

en: How did you obtain this painting?
How can I meet this quota?

tr: Üç adam 5 doları nasıl böler? Ben her birine sadece 1 dolar veririm, 2 dolar da bende kalır.

en: How can I get rid of him?
I'm afraid I caught a cold.
I'm afraid she will fail.
It sounds to me as if he has something to do with the matter.
tr: Sanki bu olayla bir ilgisi var gibi.

en: I can't figure out what he means.
I seem to have a temperature.
I seem to have a fever.

I think I have a decayed tooth.
It's not my cup of tea.
I just don't feel satisfied.
I'm sorry.

I don't get it.
There seems to be no need to go.
I think I'd better stay here.

en: I am not feeling quite up to par.
I'm afraid it will rain.

en: I can play the piano after a fashion.
At last, she hit on a good idea.
tr: Sonunda aklına iyi bir fikir geldi.

en: After all she did not come.
At last she got a job as a stewardess.
Finally the children saw a little orchard in the middle of the mountain with apple trees growing inside it.
tr: Sonunda çocuklar dağın ortasında elma ağaçlarının olduğu küçük bir meyve bahçesi gördüler.

en: Finally they gave in to their enemy.
At last he unfolded his plans for their future.
tr: Sonunda onların geleceğine dair planlarını açıkladı.

en: He was put to death finally.
At last he could finish the work.
At last he appeared.
It seems that the rainy season is over at last.
We have been completely cornered.
At last, the truth was revealed to us.
I have finally finished my homework; now I can go to bed.
At length, we reached the top of the mountain.
At last, we succeeded in solving the question.
At length, my wish was realized.
Finally, my sister got engaged.
Finally, my sister got married.
At last we can afford a house.
We finally got rid of our old car.
At last, we reached California.
At last, the day has arrived for us to act.
Summer seems to have come at last.
At last the rats came to the river.
At last, the baby fell asleep.
Eventually the salesman persuaded me to buy the expensive machine.

en: It seems to have worn out.
At last a good idea struck me.
tr: Sonunda aklıma iyi bir fikir geldi.

en: In the end, because of the disease, he became unable to walk and had to use a motorized wheelchair to get around.
tr: Sonunda hastalık yüzünden yürüyemez oldu ve dolaşmak için motorlu bir tekerlekli sandalye kullanmak zorunda kaldı.

en: Finally, she chose another kitten.
tr: Sonunda başka bir yavru kedi seçti.

en: I can't work at all with all these useless calls coming in.
tr: Bu kadar boş arama gelip durunca hiç çalışamıyorum.

en: Sing the song once more, please.
You'll have to do it, whether you like it or not.
Go ahead with your story.

Please keep it secret.
Please ring him up.
Please make way for him.
Please knock before you come in.

en: Would you please tell me the way?
May you live long!
Let me pass, please.
Please drive carefully.
Pass down the car, please.
Please step inside.
Please come in and make yourself at home.
You will please open the window.
Please take good care of yourself.
Please give me your answer by return.
Please keep quiet.
Please sit at the table.
Please go on with your dinner.

Please help me with my homework.
Please help yourself to some cake.
Please share my umbrella.
I want to speak to Mr. Sato, please.
tr: Bay Sato ile görüşebilir miyim, lütfen?

en: "Sit down, please," he said.
Please give my best regards to your parents.
Stand back, please.
Please come to my house in the afternoon.
Please don't stand on ceremony.
Please be careful of your health.

Please give your mother my best regards.
You must forgive me.

en: Please keep the fire burning.
Please warm yourself at the fire.
Please feel free to call me up.
Please feel free to make a suggestion.
Please feel free to ask questions.
Please feel free to make suggestions.
